intro: Draba altaica proles modesta, commonly known as the modest draba, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, rounded seed pods. Draba altaica proles modesta is characterized by its low-growing habit and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
